info.name: Comprehensive Translator API Tests
info.description: Complete test suite covering all scenarios for the Translator API, including all providers, models, language pairs, domains, quality levels, and format preservation options.

item.name: 1. Provider & Model Tests
item.description: Tests for each provider and their associated models

| Aspirin | 81mg | Once daily | Cardiac prophylaxis |

2. Blood pressure monitoring weekly

item.name: Markdown with Tables, Lists, and Code Blocks

body.raw:
{
    "text": "# Insurance Claim Processing Guide

## Required Documentation

* **Claim Form** (Form INS-101)
* **Proof of Loss**
  * Photos of damage
  * Repair estimates from licensed contractors
  * Police report (if applicable)
* **Policy Information**
  * Policy number
  * Coverage verification

## Claims Timeline

| Stage | Timeline | Responsible Party |
|-------|----------|-------------------|
| Initial Report | Within 48 hours of incident | Policyholder |
| Claim Assignment | 1-2 business days | Claims Department |
| Initial Assessment | 3-5 business days | Claims Adjuster |
| Documentation Review | 5-10 business days | Claims Processor |
| Decision | 15-30 business days | Senior Adjuster |
| Payment Processing | 5-7 business days after approval | Finance Department |

## Appeal Process

1. **File Written Appeal**
   * Submit Form APP-202 within 30 days of decision
   * Include any new supporting documentation
   * Specify the grounds for appeal

2. **Appeal Review**
   * Independent review by Appeal Committee
   * May request additional information
   * Decision within 45 days

3. **External Review**
   * Available if internal appeal is denied
   * Must request within 60 days of appeal decision
   * Conducted by independent third party

```
Formula for Premium Calculation:
premium = base_rate * age_factor * coverage_factor * risk_factor

where:
  base_rate = $500
  age_factor = 1 + ((age - 25) * 0.02) [minimum 1.0]
  coverage_factor = coverage_amount / 100000
  risk_factor = 1.0 (standard), 1.3 (high risk), 0.9 (low risk)
```

> **Important**: All communications regarding claims should be documented in writing. Verbal discussions should be followed up with email confirmation.",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "es",
    "domain": "insurance",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "anthropic",
    "model": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
}

{
    "text": "# Treatment Protocol: Acute Coronary Syndrome

## Initial Assessment (0-10 minutes)

1. **Vital Signs**
   * Blood pressure: Target <140/90 mmHg
   * Heart rate: Monitor for tachycardia/bradycardia
   * Oxygen saturation: Maintain >94%

2. **Immediate Interventions**
   * Oxygen therapy if saturation <94%
   * Aspirin 325mg (chewed)
   * Nitroglycerin 0.4mg SL (if SBP >90 mmHg)
   * Morphine 2-4mg IV (for pain unresponsive to nitrates)

## Diagnostic Pathway

| Test | Timing | Purpose |
|------|--------|---------|
| 12-lead ECG | Immediate (<10 min) | ST-elevation identification |
| Cardiac biomarkers | 0h, 3h, 6h | Confirm myocardial injury |
| Complete blood count | Initial | Baseline hematologic status |
| Basic metabolic panel | Initial | Electrolyte/renal function |
| Chest X-ray | When stable | Cardiac size, pulmonary congestion |

## Medication Dosing Chart

* **Antiplatelets**:
  * Aspirin: 325mg initial, then 81mg daily
  * Clopidogrel: 600mg loading, then 75mg daily
  * Ticagrelor: 180mg loading, then in 90mg BID

* **Anticoagulation**:
  * Unfractionated Heparin: 60 units/kg bolus (max 4,000 units), then 12 units/kg/hr (max 1,000 units/hr)
  * Enoxaparin: 1mg/kg SC q12h (reduce to 0.75mg/kg if age ≥75)

> **NOTE**: Document absolute/relative contraindications to thrombolysis before administration! Patient temperature should be maintained at 36.0-37.5°C during initial treatment phase.",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "zh",
    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "google",
    "model": "gemini-1.5-pro"
}

    "text": "",
    "source_language": "en",

    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "provider": "openai",
    "model": "gpt-4o"
}

{
    "text": "# Comprehensive Medical Assessment

Patient ID: 12345678
Date of Examination: 2023-11-15
Attending Physician: Dr. Sarah Johnson

## Chief Complaint

Patient presents with fatigue, shortness of breath on exertion, and occasional chest discomfort that has been present for approximately 3 weeks and is gradually worsening.

## History of Present Illness

The patient is a 58-year-old male who reports experiencing progressive fatigue and dyspnea on exertion for the past 3 weeks. He describes feeling winded after climbing one flight of stairs, which is unusual for him. Additionally, he notes intermittent chest discomfort that he describes as a 'heaviness' rather than sharp pain, typically occurring with physical activity and occasionally at rest. The discomfort does not radiate and usually resolves within 5-10 minutes of rest. He denies associated diaphoresis, nausea, or palpitations.

The patient admits to increased work-related stress over the past month and has been sleeping poorly. He has not modified his diet or exercise routine recently. No recent illness or fever reported.

## Past Medical History

* Hypertension (diagnosed 2015) - Currently managed with Lisinopril 10mg daily
* Hyperlipidemia (diagnosed 2018) - Currently managed with Atorvastatin 20mg daily
* Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (diagnosed 2019) - Currently managed with Metformin 1000mg twice daily

## Surgical History

* Appendectomy (1992)
* Right knee arthroscopy (2017)

## Family History

* Father: Deceased at age 68, myocardial infarction
* Mother: Living, age 84, hypertension, osteoarthritis
* Brother: Living, age 60, type 2 diabetes

## Social History

* Occupation: Financial analyst (desk job)
* Smoking: Former smoker, quit 10 years ago (15 pack-year history)
* Alcohol: Social drinker (2-3 drinks per week)
* Exercise: Walking 30 minutes, 2-3 times per week
* Diet: Reports 'average' diet with occasional fast food

## Medications

| Medication | Dosage | Frequency | Start Date |
|------------|--------|-----------|------------|
| Lisinopril | 10mg | Once daily | 2015 |
| Atorvastatin | 20mg | Once daily | 2018 |
| Metformin | 1000mg | Twice daily | 2019 |
| Aspirin | 81mg | Once daily | 2020 |
| Multivitamin | - | Once daily | - |

## Allergies

* Penicillin (rash)
* No other known drug allergies

## Review of Systems

### General
* Fatigue: Present, as noted in HPI
* Weight changes: Denies significant change
* Fever/chills: Absent

### Cardiovascular
* Chest pain/discomfort: Present, as noted in HPI
* Palpitations: Absent
* Edema: Minimal bilateral ankle edema noted in evenings

### Respiratory
* Shortness of breath: Present with exertion, as noted in HPI
* Cough: Absent
* Wheezing: Absent

### Gastrointestinal
* Appetite changes: Denies
* Nausea/vomiting: Absent
* Abdominal pain: Absent
* Bowel habit changes: Denies

### Genitourinary
* Urinary frequency/urgency: Mild nocturia (1-2 times per night)
* Dysuria: Absent

### Musculoskeletal
* Joint pain: Occasional right knee pain
* Muscle weakness: Generalized fatigue but no focal weakness

### Neurological
* Headaches: Occasional tension headaches
* Dizziness: Occasional light-headedness with rapid position changes
* Numbness/tingling: Absent

### Psychiatric
* Mood changes: Reports increased irritability with stress
* Sleep disturbances: Difficulty falling asleep, waking early

## Physical Examination

### Vital Signs
* Blood Pressure: 148/92 mmHg (right arm, seated)
* Heart Rate: 88 bpm, regular
* Respiratory Rate: 18 breaths per minute
* Temperature: 36.7°C (98.1°F)
* Oxygen Saturation: 96% on room air
* Height: 178 cm (5'10")
* Weight: 92 kg (203 lbs)
* BMI: 29.1 kg/m²

### General Appearance
* Well-developed, slightly overweight male appearing stated age
* Alert and oriented x3
* No acute distress

### HEENT
* Normocephalic, atraumatic
* Pupils equal, round, reactive to light
* Extraocular movements intact
* Oropharynx clear without exudates

### Neck
* No JVD or carotid bruits
* Thyroid non-palpable

### Cardiovascular
* Regular rate and rhythm
* S1, S2 normal
* S4 gallop present
* No murmurs, rubs, or clicks

### Respiratory
* Clear to auscultation bilaterally
* No wheezes, rales, or rhonchi

### Abdominal
* Soft, non-tender, non-distended
* Normal bowel sounds
* No hepatosplenomegaly

### Extremities
* Trace bilateral ankle edema
* No cyanosis or clubbing
* Pulses 2+ and symmetric in all extremities

### Neurological
* Cranial nerves II-XII intact
* Motor strength 5/5 in all extremities
* Sensation intact to light touch
* DTRs 2+ and symmetric

## Laboratory and Diagnostic Results

### Laboratory Tests (Drawn today)

| Test | Result | Reference Range | Status |
|------|--------|-----------------|--------|
| Hemoglobin | 13.8 g/dL | 13.5-17.5 g/dL | Normal |
| Hematocrit | 41% | 41-53% | Normal |
| WBC | 7.2 x 10³/μL | 4.5-11.0 x 10³/μL | Normal |
| Platelets | 245 x 10³/μL | 150-450 x 10³/μL | Normal |
| Sodium | 138 mEq/L | 135-145 mEq/L | Normal |
| Potassium | 4.2 mEq/L | 3.5-5.0 mEq/L | Normal |
| BUN | 18 mg/dL | 7-20 mg/dL | Normal |
| Creatinine | 1.1 mg/dL | 0.7-1.3 mg/dL | Normal |
| eGFR | 72 mL/min/1.73m² | >60 mL/min/1.73m² | Normal |
| Glucose (fasting) | 142 mg/dL | 70-99 mg/dL | Elevated |
| HbA1c | 7.3% | <5.7% | Elevated |
| Total Cholesterol | 195 mg/dL | <200 mg/dL | Normal |
| LDL | 118 mg/dL | <100 mg/dL | Elevated |
| HDL | 42 mg/dL | >40 mg/dL | Normal |
| Triglycerides | 175 mg/dL | <150 mg/dL | Elevated |
| Troponin I | <0.04 ng/mL | <0.04 ng/mL | Normal |
| BNP | 120 pg/mL | <100 pg/mL | Elevated |
| AST | 32 U/L | 10-40 U/L | Normal |
| ALT | 36 U/L | 7-56 U/L | Normal |

### Diagnostic Tests

#### 12-Lead ECG
* Normal sinus rhythm, rate 86 bpm
* Axis normal
* Non-specific ST-T wave changes in lateral leads (I, aVL, V5-V6)
* No acute ischemic changes

#### Chest X-ray (PA and Lateral)
* Cardiac silhouette at upper limits of normal
* No pulmonary edema or infiltrates
* No pleural effusions
* No pneumothorax

## Assessment

1. Suspected Coronary Artery Disease
   * Typical anginal symptoms (chest heaviness, exertional dyspnea)
   * Multiple cardiovascular risk factors (hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes, family history, former smoker)
   * Non-specific ECG changes
   * Mildly elevated BNP

2. Hypertension - Uncontrolled
   * BP 148/92 mmHg despite Lisinopril therapy
   * Likely contributing to current symptoms

3. Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus - Suboptimal control
   * HbA1c 7.3% (target <7.0%)
   * Fasting glucose 142 mg/dL

4. Dyslipidemia - Partially controlled
   * LDL 118 mg/dL (target <70 mg/dL for high-risk patients)
   * Elevated triglycerides

5. Obesity (BMI 29.1 kg/m²)
   * Contributes to overall cardiovascular risk

## Plan

### Diagnostic
1. Cardiac stress test (Exercise stress echocardiogram) - Scheduled for tomorrow
2. Complete lipid panel with apolipoprotein B, lipoprotein(a)
3. 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure monitoring
4. Sleep study to evaluate for potential obstructive sleep apnea

### Therapeutic
1. Cardiovascular
   * Increase Lisinopril to 20mg daily for better BP control
   * Add Amlodipine 5mg daily
   * Continue Aspirin 81mg daily
   * Add sublingual nitroglycerin 0.4mg PRN for chest discomfort - instruct on use

2. Diabetes Management
   * Continue Metformin 1000mg twice daily
   * Initiate blood glucose home monitoring fasting and 2 hours post-prandial
   * Referral to diabetes education program

3. Lipid Management
   * Increase Atorvastatin to 40mg daily

### Lifestyle Modifications
1. Dietary
   * Low sodium (<2g daily) DASH diet
   * Limit carbohydrates, especially refined sugars
   * Increase fiber intake

2. Exercise
   * Once cleared by stress test, recommend moderate intensity exercise (e.g., walking) for 30 minutes, 5 times per week, gradually increasing as tolerated

3. Stress Management
   * Sleep hygiene counseling
   * Consider mindfulness or meditation techniques

### Follow-up
1. Return to office in 2 weeks with stress test results
2. Cardiology consultation scheduled
3. Phone check-in with nurse in 3 days to assess symptoms and medication tolerance

## Patient Education

* Discussed the nature of coronary artery disease, risk factors, and warning signs of acute coronary syndrome
* Reviewed symptoms that should prompt immediate medical attention (severe chest pain, pain radiating to jaw/arm, significant shortness of breath, syncope)
* Instructed on proper use of sublingual nitroglycerin
* Discussed target blood glucose ranges and monitoring schedule
* Provided written information on DASH diet
* Encouraged stress reduction techniques

## Final Note

Plan discussed with patient who verbalized understanding and agreement. All questions addressed. Patient expressed motivation to improve health status and adhere to the recommended plan. Spent 45 minutes with patient, majority of which was counseling and coordination of care.",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "es",
    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "openai",
    "model": "gpt-4o"
}

{
    "text": "# Commercial Property Insurance Policy

## Policy Information

Policy Number: CP-12345678
Effective Date: January 1, 2023
Expiration Date: January 1, 2024
Named Insured: ABC Manufacturing, Inc.
Insured Location: 123 Industrial Parkway, Metropolis, ST 12345

## Declarations Page

### Coverage Limits

| Coverage Type | Limit of Insurance | Deductible |
|--------------|---------------------|------------|
| Building | $2,500,000 | $10,000 |
| Business Personal Property | $1,200,000 | $5,000 |
| Business Income | $750,000 | 72 hours |
| Extra Expense | $250,000 | N/A |
| Outdoor Property | $50,000 | $1,000 |
| Valuable Papers | $100,000 | $500 |

### Premium Summary

* Base Premium: $42,500
* Terrorism Risk Insurance Act Coverage: $2,125
* Equipment Breakdown Endorsement: $3,800
* Flood Insurance Endorsement: $12,750
* Earthquake Sprinkler Leakage Coverage: $5,300

**Total Annual Premium: $66,475**

## Section I - Property Coverage

### A. Covered Property

1. **Building**, meaning the building or structure described in the Declarations, including:
   * Completed additions
   * Fixtures, including outdoor fixtures
   * Permanently installed machinery and equipment
   * Personal property owned by you that is used to maintain or service the building

2. **Business Personal Property** located in or on the building described in the Declarations, including:
   * Furniture and fixtures
   * Machinery and equipment
   * Stock (raw materials, work in process, finished goods)
   * All other personal property owned by you and used in your business
   * Leased personal property which you have a contractual responsibility to insure

### B. Additional Coverages

1. **Debris Removal** - We will pay your expense to remove debris of Covered Property caused by a Covered Cause of Loss.
   * Limit: 25% of the sum of the deductible plus the amount paid for direct physical loss
   * Additional Limit: $10,000 when the sum of direct physical loss and debris removal exceeds the Limit of Insurance

2. **Preservation of Property** - If it is necessary to move Covered Property from the described premises to preserve it from loss or damage by a Covered Cause of Loss, we will pay for any direct physical loss or damage to that property.
   * Time Limit: 30 days after removal

3. **Fire Department Service Charge**
   * Limit: $5,000

4. **Pollutant Clean-up and Removal**
   * Limit: $25,000 annual aggregate
   * Time Frame: 180 days from date of loss

5. **Increased Cost of Construction**
   * Coverage applies only when replacement cost valuation is shown in Declarations
   * Limited to costs to comply with minimum standards of ordinance or law
   * Limit: $100,000

### C. Covered Causes of Loss

This policy provides "Special Form" coverage, meaning direct physical loss unless the loss is excluded or limited in this policy.

### D. Exclusions

1. **Ordinance or Law** - Except as provided under Additional Coverages - Increased Cost of Construction
2. **Earth Movement** - Including earthquake, landslide, mine subsidence, earth sinking or shifting
3. **Governmental Action** - Seizure or destruction of property by order of governmental authority
4. **Nuclear Hazard** - Nuclear reaction or radiation, or radioactive contamination
5. **Utility Services** - Failure of power, communication, water or other utility service
6. **War and Military Action** - War, insurrection, rebellion, revolution
7. **Water**
   * Flood, surface water, waves, tides, tidal waves, overflow of any body of water
   * Mudslide or mudflow
   * Water that backs up or overflows from a sewer, drain or sump
   * Water under the ground surface pressing on, or flowing or seeping through foundations, walls, floors or paved surfaces
8. **Fungi, Wet Rot, Dry Rot and Bacteria** - Presence, growth, proliferation, spread or any activity of fungi, wet or dry rot or bacteria

### E. Limits of Insurance

The most we will pay for loss or damage in any one occurrence is the applicable Limit of Insurance shown in the Declarations.

### F. Deductible

We will not pay for loss or damage in any one occurrence until the amount of loss or damage exceeds the Deductible shown in the Declarations. We will then pay the amount of loss or damage in excess of the Deductible, up to the applicable Limit of Insurance.

## Section II - Business Income and Extra Expense Coverage

### A. Business Income

We will pay for the actual loss of Business Income you sustain due to the necessary suspension of your "operations" during the "period of restoration". The suspension must be caused by direct physical loss of or damage to property at the described premises. The loss or damage must be caused by or result from a Covered Cause of Loss.

Business Income means the:
1. Net Income (Net Profit or Loss before income taxes) that would have been earned or incurred; and
2. Continuing normal operating expenses incurred, including payroll.

### B. Extra Expense

Extra Expense means necessary expenses you incur during the "period of restoration" that you would not have incurred if there had been no direct physical loss or damage to property.

We will pay Extra Expense (other than the expense to repair or replace property) to:
1. Avoid or minimize the suspension of business and to continue operations at the described premises or at replacement premises or temporary locations
2. Minimize the suspension of business if you cannot continue operations

### C. Period of Restoration

"Period of Restoration" means the period of time that:
1. Begins 72 hours after the time of direct physical loss or damage caused by or resulting from any Covered Cause of Loss at the described premises; and
2. Ends on the earlier of:
   * The date when the property at the described premises should be repaired, rebuilt or replaced with reasonable speed and similar quality; or
   * The date when business is resumed at a new permanent location.

Period of Restoration does not include any increased period required due to enforcement of any ordinance or law that requires any insured or others to test for, monitor, clean up, remove, contain, treat, detoxify or neutralize, or in any way respond to, or assess the effects of "pollutants".

## Section III - General Conditions

### A. Concealment, Misrepresentation or Fraud

This policy is void in any case of fraud by you as it relates to this policy at any time. It is also void if you or any other insured, at any time, intentionally conceal or misrepresent a material fact concerning:
1. This policy;
2. The Covered Property;
3. Your interest in the Covered Property; or
4. A claim under this policy.

### B. Control of Property

Any act or neglect of any person other than you beyond your direction or control will not affect this insurance.

### C. Insurance Under Two or More Coverages

If two or more of this policy's coverages apply to the same loss or damage, we will not pay more than the actual amount of the loss or damage.

### D. Legal Action Against Us

No one may bring a legal action against us under this policy unless:
1. There has been full compliance with all of the terms of this policy; and
2. The action is brought within 2 years after the date on which the direct physical loss or damage occurred.

### E. Liberalization

If we adopt any revision that would broaden the coverage under this policy without additional premium within 45 days prior to or during the policy period, the broadened coverage will immediately apply to this policy.

### F. No Benefit to Bailee

No person or organization, other than you, having custody of Covered Property will benefit from this insurance.

### G. Other Insurance

1. You may have other insurance subject to the same plan, terms, conditions and provisions as the insurance under this policy. If you do, we will pay our share of the covered loss or damage. Our share is the proportion that the applicable Limit of Insurance under this policy bears to the Limits of Insurance of all insurance covering on the same basis.
2. If there is other insurance covering the same loss or damage, other than that described in 1. above, we will pay only for the amount of covered loss or damage in excess of the amount due from that other insurance, whether you can collect on it or not. But we will not pay more than the applicable Limit of Insurance.

### H. Policy Period, Coverage Territory

Under this policy:
1. We cover loss or damage commencing during the policy period shown in the Declarations; and
2. The coverage territory is the United States of America (including its territories and possessions), Puerto Rico and Canada.

### I. Transfer of Rights of Recovery Against Others to Us

If any person or organization to or for whom we make payment under this policy has rights to recover damages from another, those rights are transferred to us to the extent of our payment. That person or organization must do everything necessary to secure our rights and must do nothing after loss to impair them.

## Section IV - Definitions

1. **Pollutants** means any solid, liquid, gaseous or thermal irritant or contaminant, including smoke, vapor, soot, fumes, acids, alkalis, chemicals and waste. Waste includes materials to be recycled, reconditioned or reclaimed.

2. **Stock** means merchandise held in storage or for sale, raw materials and in-process or finished goods, including supplies used in their packing or shipping.

3. **Valuable Papers and Records** means inscribed, printed or written documents, manuscripts or records, including abstracts, books, deeds, drawings, films, maps or mortgages. But valuable papers and records does not mean money or securities, converted data, programs or instructions used in your data processing operations, including the materials on which the data is recorded.

## Section V - Claim Procedures

### A. Duties in the Event of Loss or Damage

You must see that the following are done in the event of loss or damage to Covered Property:
1. Notify the police if a law may have been broken.
2. Give us prompt notice of the loss or damage. Include a description of the property involved.
3. As soon as possible, give us a description of how, when and where the loss or damage occurred.
4. Take all reasonable steps to protect the Covered Property from further damage.
5. At our request, give us complete inventories of the damaged and undamaged property. Include quantities, costs, values and amount of loss claimed.
6. Permit us to inspect the property and records proving the loss or damage.
7. If requested, permit us to question you under oath at such times as may be reasonably required about any matter relating to this insurance or your claim.
8. Send us a signed, sworn proof of loss containing the information we request to investigate the claim.
9. Cooperate with us in the investigation or settlement of the claim.

### B. Settlement Options

In the event of covered loss or damage, we will either:
1. Pay the value of lost or damaged property;
2. Pay the cost of repairing or replacing the lost or damaged property;
3. Take all or any part of the property at an agreed or appraised value; or
4. Repair, rebuild or replace the property with other property of like kind and quality.

### C. Valuation

We will determine the value of Covered Property in the event of loss or damage as follows:
1. At replacement cost (without deduction for depreciation), except as provided in 2. through 7. below.
2. If you do not repair or replace the damaged or destroyed property, we will pay actual cash value at the time of loss or damage.
3. Stock you have sold but not delivered at the selling price less discounts and expenses you otherwise would have had.
4. Glass at the cost of replacement with safety glazing material if required by law.
5. Tenant's Improvements and Betterments at actual cash value if you do not make repairs promptly.
6. Valuable Papers and Records at the cost of restoration or replacement.
7. Electronic Data Processing Equipment and Software at replacement cost.

## Policyholder Service Information

### Claims Reporting

In the event of a loss, please contact our 24-hour claims service center:
* Phone: 1-800-555-CLAIM
* Email: claims@insuranceco.com
* Online: www.insuranceco.com/claims

### Risk Management Services

As a valued policyholder, you have access to the following risk management services at no additional cost:
* Property conservation consultation
* Fire protection system evaluation
* Business continuity planning assistance
* Infrared thermography testing (one free inspection per policy period)

To schedule any of these services, please contact our Risk Management Department at 1-800-555-RISK.",
